snippet: President Obama’s accommodation to church groups was not needed, but it preserves the basic principle of free access to birth control for any woman.
abstract: Editorial argues that Pres Obama did not need to accommodate religious institutions by allowing them to shift the cost of contraceptives to their insurance companies, but at least his rule preserves the basic principle of free access to birth control for any woman.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s accommodation to church groups was not needed, but it preserves the basic principle of free access to birth control for any woman.

headline.seo: The Freedom to Choose Birth Control
